The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed better writing skills and learned how to write academically. I believe that this course has set me up to continue writing successfully as I continue to learn these next four years.

Censorship
Critical thinking
Textual analysis
Independent research
Writing

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths are the readings and the ability to receive an ungraded first draft in this course. The weakness of this course, however, is that instructions can sometimes be on the vague side.
Strengths: A good variation between essay formats; we had an op-ed, a research paper, and a few argument essays based on reading.

weaknesses: i have have experienced racism from prof. robinson. he is extremely unprofessional and used curses (like f*ck) very frequently without seeking student consent. he made very unreasonable and offensive assumptions about students' backgrounds (brazilian, middle eastern e.t.c) and politicized classroom discourse. he also weaponized the israel-palestine conflict by using irresponsible, Islamophobic language and hurting student sentiments in an unprovoked fashion. he is also assertive in expressing his Zionist opinions and pseudo-victimizes himself. he does not organize office hours to discuss student writing. he also doesn't reply to emails very promptly. he uses his tenured privilege to steer away from the syllabus and incorporates his personal experiences quite incessantly. please don't take this class if you want to protect your sanity.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student, as it is a low-stress and engaging introduction to writing at Yale.
Yes, I would recommend this course. It is a great way to ease into college writing.

Yes
The prof is responsible in a non confrontational way. He makes sure you do the reading and writing. Hes kinda funny and very talkative. I wouldnt say that one should take it bc of the prof but he certainly doesnt make it unenjoyable. Plus you get to learn about censorship which is always important.
no. im so shook from this class.
